statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Brad Buckman scored 18 points and blocked seven shots to lead Texas (No. 13 ESPN/USA Today, No. 14 AP)  to an 86-57 victory over North Texas on Tuesday night.
article.headline: Buckman one short of school record for blocks
article.linkText: Buckman scores 18, blocks 7 to lead Texas
article.story: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) -- Brad Buckman didn't block every shot North Texas put up Tuesday night. It just seemed that way. Buckman scored 18 points and blocked seven shots -- one short of the Texas single-game record -- in leading the Longhorns (No. 13 ESPN/USA Today, No. 14 AP) to an 86-57 victory over North Texas. "I've got long arms," Buckman said. "I've got to use them for something." Buckman picked up three blocks in the first three minutes and swatted shots all game long against a Mean Green team that started the game 1-of-15 from the floor and put up seven airballs in the first half. "That's terrible. I don't care who you're playing or where you're playing," said Leonard Hopkins, who led North Texas with 13 points. "He (Buckman) was jumping everywhere, slapping a lot of 3-point shots we usually knock down," Hopkins said. "He was just playing hard tonight trying to get his hand on everything." The Longhorns (6-1), who have shot 3-pointers with abandon early this season, did most of their damage in the paint against North Texas (3-3). Jason Klotz had 14 points and LaMarcus Aldridge scored 12. Buckman, who struggled last year as a sophomore, had his second strong outing in as many games. He had 11 points and eight rebounds in a win over Seton Hall. "These last couple of days coach has been getting on me for not posting up hard and demanding the ball," Buckman said. "When I did, I got the ball in the paint and got these easy chip shots." Texas coach Rick Barnes acknowledged he has pushed Buckman hard in practice. "We spent two days working really hard with our post guys getting a more physical presence inside," Barnes said. "I told him `When we give you the ball, we need to know what you're going to do with it.' "The last two games, he's played harder than he has in three years," Barnes said. Texas got off to a ragged start, twice stopping the game in the first half because they didn't have the right number of players on the court. The Longhorns were hit with a technical foul when they had six players on the floor -- game officials had restarted play before noting the extra player -- and later delayed a restart when they only had four. "They've been doing some experimental rules this year," Barnes joked. "I wanted to see how long it would take before they figured it out." Texas led by just nine late in the first half after the Mean Green's Calvin Watkins hit a long 3-pointer to make it 31-22. That's when Texas started a 15-2 run to close the half and open things up. Buckman scored five in the burst. He was sitting on the floor after diving for a loose ball when he passed to P.J Tucker for a spinning layup that started the spurt. Kenny Taylor hit a 3-pointer and Daniel Gibson hit another with 2.8 seconds left in the half to make it 46-24. North Texas cut the deficit to 61-47 with a 13-2 run, but Texas ended the Mean Green's comeback hopes as Gibson hit a 3-pointer, Aldridge and Tucker had back-to-back dunks and Buckman hit consecutive buckets to make it 78-49. "It's almost like you have to pick your poison and decide which way you're going to allow them to score," said North Texas coach Johnny Jones.
